In order to retain this funding, you will be required to comply with the following terms and conditions: 1. Read and understood the Learnership Guidelines for Unemployed Youth and/or Learnership Guidelines for Employed, as applicable
2. Read and understood the Discretionary Grant Monitoring and Evaluation Policy and Guidelines
3. Accommodate any site visit from any INSETA official as per the Discretionary Grant Monitoring and Evaluation Policy and Guidelines
4. Ensure that you receive approval from INSETA for any changes/deviations from the approved application
In addition, you will be required to submit the following to the Learning Division. Failure to submit to the Learning Division at the agreed
time will result in the cancellation of the Learnership
5. This letter must be signed by the authorised signatory and returned to INSETA within 10 working days of receipt
6. Invoice in accordance with Learnership Guidelines for Unemployed Youth and/or Learnership Guidelines for Employed,
whichever is applicable, and submit the first tranche invoice on request
7. Progress reports at midpoint of learnership
8. Payslips (for unemployed learners, if applicable) at midpoint of learnership
9. Closure report 14 days after closure of the programme
10. Payslips (for unemployed learners, if applicable) at closure of learnership
11. Termination reports within 14 days of learner termination from the programme
GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS:
1. This funding agreement terminates upon discharge by INSETA and the Employer, of the obligations contained in this document
2. Any termination of learners within the period of this funding agreement will result in the automatic adjustment of the funding value
3. INSETA may terminate the commitment at any time in part or in full without prejudice to any rights to which it is entitled in terms of the law or by virtue of this Agreement if the Employer:
Deviates substantially from the aims and objectives of the programme without consulting INSETA and obtaining prior approval
Fails to meet any of its obligations arising from relevant legislation, the Learnership Guidelines for Unemployed/Employed and those appearing in this Agreement
Breaches any terms of this agreement and those arising from relevant legislation and fails to rectify the breach within 14 days of receipt of the INSETAâ€™s written notice.
4. In the case of breach or termination of this contract, INSETA may, without further notice to Employer:
Discontinue any further payment
Reclaim in full or in part any amount already paid
Decline any further funding applications from the employer
5. In the event that any of the parties to this agreement is unable to perform any of their respective obligations in terms of this agreement, and such non-performance results from
occurrences beyond the reasonable control of the parties concerned, such failure shall not constitute a breach of this contract
6. Note all administration and Invoices must be submitted to INSETA on due date failing which all funds not utilised for the purposes allocated will revert to INSETA automatically,
without further notification.
Please note that any portion of the Discretionary Grant not used for purposes allocated during the period of the programme will revert to INSETA
